page.title: 19STREAM STUDY, SOMERFORD AREA
page.content: The stream,which is known as the willows because of the trees around it,runs into the River Avon.We studied this for two hours in one week and we found out a lot about this brook.We found this information out in July. Most of the ditches in Great Somerford run into this stream.There are lots of minnows and insects living in this stream.We saw caddisfly larvae,beetles leeches,shrimps,dragonflies and mayfly nymphs.There are quite a lot of common birds around the willows.We saw a family of blue tits and a family of chaffinches and a family of great tits.The surroundings at the willows are perfect for birds to nest in and some are well camouflaged. A funnel fixed to a big jam jar makes a useful minnow trap. There are lots of wild plants round the stream, such as forget-me-nots and red campion.
